context_of_use: This use case allows admins to create, update, and control user accounts and access rights within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control system access through user account management.
description: This use case enables admins to manage user accounts effectively to ensure proper access control.
triggering_event: Admin initiates the management of user accounts.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage user accounts.
postconditions: User accounts are created, updated, or deleted as per admin actions.
Access rights for users are modified as required.
assumptions: The admin has valid credentials to access the user management functionalities.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to create user accounts.
The system shall allow admins to update user account information.
The system shall allow admins to delete user accounts.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific permissions required for different user roles.
main_flow: 1. Admin initiates user account management → System displays user account management options.
2. Admin selects to create a new user account → System prompts for user details.
3. Admin enters user details and submits → System creates the user account and confirms creation.
4. Admin selects to update an existing user account → System displays current user account details.
5. Admin modifies user account details and submits → System updates the user account and confirms the update.
6. Admin selects to delete a user account → System prompts for confirmation.
7. Admin confirms deletion → System deletes the user account and confirms deletion.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): Admin selects to authenticate before managing user accounts → System prompts for authentication → Admin enters credentials → System verifies credentials and grants access to user account management.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If user details are incomplete → System displays an error message indicating required fields.
